notes: Final years Saab 9-3 (2003-2014). GM Epsilon platform. Production continued briefly after bankruptcy under NEVS ownership. V6 turbo Aero with AWD. Brand bankruptcy 2011, final production 2014. Data sourced from Wikipedia Saab 9-3 article, January 2025 revision.

Second-generation Saab 9-5 (2010-2012). GM Epsilon II platform. XWD all-wheel drive available. Modern design, but short production due to Saab bankruptcy 2011. Limited production numbers. Timing chain turbo engines. Data sourced from Wikipedia Saab 9-5 article, January 2025 revision.

Saab 9-4X crossover SUV (2011 only). Theta Premium platform shared with Cadillac SRX. All-wheel drive standard. V6 turbo engine. Built in Mexico. Only ~800 units produced before Saab bankruptcy. Timing chain engine. Data sourced from Wikipedia Saab 9-4X article, January 2025 revision.
